Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, belly amphora or olpe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of siren to right (right wing with added red, traces of hair, and part of body and tail with red remaining); wing and tail overlap panel border; incised blob rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 457-8, no. B771)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0009) (Phase 1)
